data.title: Low cost carriers by revenue
data.meta_description: In 2022, Southwest generated the highest revenue compared to the selected low cost airlines, amounting to 23.8 billion U.S.
data.text:
Supplementary notes

Figures have been rounded.

All figures are for the calendar year 2022. Data has been compiled by Statista using the following sources:

Data for Southwest Airlines can be accessed here.

Data for JetBlue can be accessed here.

Data for Spirit Airlines can be accessed here.

Data for Ryanair can be accessed here. Figure was converted from EUR to USD at a conversion rate of 1.1074, as of 31st of March 2023. Ryanair’s financial year ends on the 31st of March each year.

Data for EasyJet can be accessed here. Figure was converted from GBP to USD at a conversion rate of 1.115, as of 30th of September 2022, easyJet’s financial year ends on the 30th of September each year.

Data for Wizz Air can be accessed here. Figure was converted from EUR to USD at a conversion rate of 1.1074, as of December 31, 2021. Wizz Air’s financial year ends on the 31st of March each year.

Data for Eurowings can be accessed here. Figure was converted from EUR to USD at a conversion rate of 1.1074, as of December 31, 2021. Eurowings’ financial year ends on the 31st of March each year.

Data for Norwegian can be accessed here. Figure was converted from NOK to USD at a conversion rate of 0.1021, as of December 31, 2022. Norwegian Air Shuttle’s financial year ends on the 31st of March each year.

Data for AirAsia can be accessed here. Figure was converted from MYR to USD at a conversion rate of 0.22606, as of December 31, 2022. AirAsia’s financial year ends on the 31st of March each year.
